items.sentence: I told Tom I didn\'t care about his problems.
You might want to bring an umbrella with you.
Tom never lets anyone forget that he\'s rich.
Tom isn\'t the only one here who can\'t swim.
I\'m sure you\'ll wish you hadn\'t done that.
I\'m sure you\'ll wish you hadn\'t said that.
We climbed high enough to see the whole city.
Tom covered Mary\'s shoulders with a blanket.
Tom spent the whole afternoon playing tennis.
Tom told me that he bought a house in Boston.
Tom told me that he liked this kind of music.
You should wash new sheets before using them.
I don\'t think Tom has ever been here before.
I don\'t think Tom has ever done that before.
I don\'t think Tom has ever had a girlfriend.
I don\'t think Tom is coming back here today.
I don\'t think Tom is going to need our help.
Tom is taller than both Mary and her brother.
I\'ve heard that Tom bought an expensive car.
I\'ve known Tom since he was three years old.
